Story: I glance at my phone, heart pounding. The text from my friend stings: “Did you really mean what you said earlier?” I replay my careless comment in my mind, realizing how much it must have hurt. As a friend, I know I should call her right now, apologize, and talk it through before the misunderstanding festers. But I’m standing behind my client, hands tangled in her hair, thick with product buildup. She’s waiting for me to work my magic, expecting a relaxing wash and a fresh style. I can’t just leave her mid-appointment—she’s paid for my full attention, and her hair needs serious care before I can even think about cutting. My phone buzzes again. I feel torn, guilt gnawing at me. My friend needs me, but so does my client. I grip the comb, my mind racing, caught between the urge to fix my mistake as a friend and my duty as a professional hairdresser.
